p.s: Barack ObamasObama's speech On the American Dream, which he held on 7th November 2007 in Iowa during his first election campaign, is about the American Dream and why it is worth fighting for.
At the beginning he talks about his campaign and what he has observed as he has traveledtravelled around the country.
He points out that all Americans have common hopes and dreams, that they share the same values and hopes.
That there are no differences because of a personsperson's background, look, gender or religion.
He said, that one can see, how well the multicultural coexistence works in America.
Secondly, he talks about his family and the values he grew up with.
He named his grandfather and his mother as the perfect examples for living and achieving the American Dream.

His grandfather werewas able to go to the college and to buy a home, by working hard at different jobs, so ObamasObama's mother got a good education and therefore a good foundation for living her dream.
In the last part Obama disscussesdiscusses how he sees that the euphoria of the American Dream is slowly slipping away.
That there are Jobsjobs disappearing and that there are people who need help.
But he believes so much in AmericasAmerica's ideology, that he wants to unite the people to fight for their dreams.
